p: T Cells. T cells clearly play a major role in resolution of active infection. RSV-specific T cells with cytolytic activity, thought to be CD8+ T cells, have been detected in peripheral blood mononuclear cells from infants with RSV disease [ 131]. Immunodeficient children, especially those with T cell defects, often fail to clear RSV infection and can shed virus for many months [ 57]. Adults with leukemia or hematopoietic stem cell transplant also have a very high incidence of prolonged RSV infection leading to severe disease and sometimes death.
